intro: Ribes columbianum, commonly known as the Columbia gooseberry, is a shrub native to western North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its flowers are small and yellow. The berries are edible, though they are often tart and used in jams or wines.
